msContents.summary: Letter of Neesis to Zenon reporting that he went to his shop in Herakleopolis and shifted 10 workers from there to his other shop in Philadelphia where he also left some money

msItemStruct.note: Plate in P.Col. III facing p. 130
Written across the fibers in 10 lines; on the back the address along the fibers
Written in broad strokes with a brush

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 16 (original no. 47) in Bell

div.ab: Ne?sis to Zenon greeting. I went to Herakleopolis to give money to the workmen. So I gave it to them and sent to Philadelphia four employees and six hired workmen in order that they might serve under me. You wrote to Petobastis to give me 100 drachmas. I have received from him 60 drachmas. I am leaving the money there so that the shop may not be idle, and it will be necessary to us that the shop be not idle.
